page.title: 14Seal Village
page.content: Seal is a village situated on the A25. It is mainly a residential area, but it does have a farm and a few shops. The A25 is a fairly busy road and became the subject of argument a few years ago because of the number of lorries passing through Seal. The issue was solved with the building of the M26 which diverts much of the long-distance traffic. The shops of the village are of an unusual nature. There are two expensive restaurants and an antique shop, but the ordinary grocers shops are continually changing hands due to lack of custom. Seal is obviously an attraction for the rich and eccentric! There are also four pubs and two petrol stations, one of which used to be the village forge. The oldest attraction is the 700 year old church set in farmland. Housing is varied, with a few expensive homes.
